p: The ability of the tested extract to inhibit the production of violacein by C. violaceum strains (ATCC 14272 and CV026) was assayed using the methods described by Noumi et al. [ 86]. Serial dilutions of the sample (MIC, MIC/2, MIC/4, MIC/8, and using LB broth as the diluent) were tested against C. violaceum CV 026 and the assay plates were incubated at 30 Â°C for 3 days. Each sample was tested in triplicate. Inhibition of quorum sensing was calculated using the protocol described by Zaki et al. [ 98] and activity is interpreted using the following scheme: a quorum sensing inhibition zone < 10 mm was considered moderate activity and when the QSI zone > 10 mm it was designated a potent effect.
